{"step_by_step_thinking": "Outlet forceps are used in the final stage of labor to assist in the delivery of the baby. The complications listed are all potential risks associated with the use of outlet forceps. However, the least likely complication would be a cervical tear. This is because by the time outlet forceps are used, the cervix is fully dilated and the baby's head is in the vaginal canal, so the forceps are unlikely to cause damage to the cervix.", "answer_choice": "D"}
